Description: Corroded copper alloy button, circular with domed top, hollow underside with a central curved bar for attachment. This item is one of a pair with 1887, 0101.1095 from the same collection.
Findspot: Found/Acquired: Tell Dafana, Probably from the desert N of the site, towards Tell Belim.
Curator's comments: One of the bronze "buttons made concavo-convex, with a bar across the concave back pierced for sewing on", mentioned by W.M.F. Petrie, Tanis ii, Nebesheh and Defenneh, p. 80 § 80.
Bibliographic references: Petrie 1888 / Tanis. Part II. Nebesheh (Am) and Defenneh (Tahpanhes) (p. 80 § 80)
Leclère and Spencer 2014 / Tell Dafana Reconsidered: The Archaeology of an Egyptian Frontier Town (p.81, p.186, pl.28)
